observations: There are groups of contiguous non-zero cells in the input that are shifted.
The shifted group maintains its original configuration.
The direction of the shift seems to be dependent on the arrangement of the non-zero values.
hypotheses: Non-zero value groups are moved along diagonals, reflecting them off boundaries when applicable.
Non-zero value groups are moved based on a learned vector field derived from the input's structure.
Each non-zero value group moves to the nearest location that leaves a zero-valued cell free below, to the right, or diagonally down and right.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Non-zero value groups are moved along diagonals, reflecting them off boundaries when applicable.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In example 1, the group '4 3 3' would not reflect down correctly to create '3 3 3' on the bottom row.

selected_rule: Non-zero value groups are moved based on a learned vector field derived from the input's structure.
step_plan: Identify all contiguous groups of non-zero cells.
Determine a vector field based on the input grid.
Move each group according to the local vector field value.
